plants.name: Chrysanthemum indicum
plants.description: A popular autumn-blooming garden plant with dense flower heads composed of many small flowers. Chrysanthemums are often associated with fall festivals and are highly diverse in color and form.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, especially East Asia, Europe, and North America
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums represent longevity and rejuvenation in many Asian cultures and are often used in tea.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub famous for its large, rose-like flowers that bloom in late fall to early spring, depending on the cultivar. Camellias thrive in mild temperate climates with acidic well-drained soil.
plants.location: East Asia, Southern US, and temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellia flowers were introduced to Europe in the 18th century and led to the popular 'tea plant' family, as Camellia sinensis is the source of tea leaves.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native tree with striking orange to golden flowers arranged in bottlebrush-like clusters that bloom in late spring through early summer in Australia but can bloom in the Northern Hemisphere's autumn when grown there.
plants.location: Australia and cultivated in subtropical and Mediterranean climates globally
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, Silky Oak is not related to oaks; its wood is valued for furniture and musical instruments.

plants.name: Bougainvillea glabra
plants.description: A vibrant, thorny vine or shrub known for its colorful papery bracts that surround small, inconspicuous white flowers. It blooms almost year-round in tropical and subtropical climates, including November.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, including November
plants.funFact: Bougainvillea bracts are modified leaves that attract pollinators, often mistaken as flower petals.
